clinical_study.brief_title: The Importance of Electrical Stimulation as a Treatment for Urinary Incontinence in Patients Prostatectomy
clinical_study.official_title: The Importance of Electrical Stimulation as a Treatment for Urinary Incontinence in Patients Undergoing Prostatectomy to Exercise the Pelvic Floor Muscles (MAPs): Randomised Controlled Trial, Double Blind

brief_summary.textblock: The use of electrical stimulation to reduce urinary incontinence in men undergoing prostatectomy exercises of the pelvic floor muscles (MAPs)

detailed_description.textblock: The study will be an experiment with active control, randomized, double-blind, parallel intervention. After met the eligibility criteria of the patients will be randomly allocated into two groups: Group exercises MAPs (GEX), which is the active control group and electrostimulation + exercises MAPs (GEEX).

arm_group.description: this group will make the electrostimulation with exercises of the pelvic floor muscles with a focus on strengthening the pelvic floor muscles.
This group will focus exercises of the pelvic floor muscles with strengthening the muscles of the pelvic floor

intervention.description: this group will make the electrostimulation with exercises of the pelvic floor muscles with a focus on strengthening the pelvic floor muscles.the frequency will be 20 sessions, 2 times per week, lasting 30 minutes.

intervention.description: This group will focus exercises of the pelvic floor muscles with strengthening the muscles of the pelvic floor. the frequency will be 20 sessions, 2 times per week, lasting 30 minutes.
intervention.other_name: exercises of the pelvic floor muscles

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patients with urinary sphincter deficiency resulting from a radical prostatectomy surgery
- sent by urologists the same hospital where the experiment will take place
- having the maximum time six months after surgery
- to use 2 to 5 disposable protective per day
Exclusion Criteria:
- Symptoms of urinary tract infection
- symptoms of lower urinary tract obstruction
- anal fistula
- metallic implant in the body
- transurethral resection of prostate
- radiation therapy
- non-enforcement of the proposed treatment.
